subject: Relationships
title: Self-Betrayal: Breaking Trust With Yourself
description: A quick win: understand Self-Betrayal: Breaking Trust With Yourself.

hook.text: You promised yourself you'd leave. You stayed. The deepest trust wound isn't from others â€” it's from yourself.

buildup.text: Self-betrayal happens when you ignore your values, needs, or boundaries to keep the peace or please others.

discovery.text: Repeated self-betrayal erodes self-trust. You stop believing your own promises because you've broken them too often.

twist.text: Rebuilding self-trust starts tiny: making a small promise to yourself and keeping it. Then another. Then another.

climax.text: You can't fully trust others until you trust yourself. Self-trust is the foundation every other trust is built on.

punchline.text: Self-trust is the foundation. You can't trust others until you trust yourself.

quiz.question: How does self-betrayal affect trust?
options: It erodes self-trust, making it harder to trust anyone
